articles.author: Kristen ShiltonESPN NHL reporter
articles.title: Colorado Avalanche travel without injured Andre Burakovsky ahead of Game 3 of Stanley Cup Final
articles.description: Avalanche forward Andre Burakovsky is staying back in Denver for at least one more day to be evaluated for an injury. Burakovsky has not been ruled out for Monday's Game 3.
articles.content: DENVER -- Colorado's Andre Burakovsky will not travel with the team to Tampa on Sunday after suffering an injury in the Avalanche's 7-0 drubbing of the Lightning in Game 2 of the Stanley Cup Final on… [+1888 chars]

articles.title: FINA votes to restrict transgender women from elite swimming competition
articles.description: Swimming's world governing body FINA has voted to restrict the participation of transgender athletes in elite women's competitions and create a working group to establish an "open" category for them in some events.
articles.content: Swimming's world governing body FINA on Sunday voted to restrict the participation of transgender athletes in elite women's competitions and create a working group to establish an "open" category for… [+907 chars]

articles.title: Los Angeles Dodgers set to send Mookie Betts, 'one of the best players in baseball, to injured list
articles.description: Los Angeles star outfielder Mookie Betts is headed to the injured list, Dodgers manager Dave Roberts told reporters on Saturday night, after an MRI revealed a cracked rib that the club isn't yet certain of its full severity.
articles.content:
LOS ANGELES -- Los Angeles Dodgers outfielder Mookie Betts is headed to the injured list, manager Dave Roberts said Saturday night.

articles.title: Will Zalatoris, Matt Fitzpatrick emerge with lead at U.S. Open; Jon Rahm stumbles on 18
articles.description: Will Zalatoris and Matt Fitzpatrick emerged atop the leaderboard at the U.S. Open on Saturday during a brutal round in which eight players had at least a share of the lead at some point.
articles.content:
BROOKLINE, Mass. -- Will Zalatoris and Matt Fitzpatrick avoided the carnage and calamity that took down golf's best Saturday at a U.S. Open that set the tone for a final day of survival.

articles.title: Los Angeles Lakers to hire Atlanta Hawks assistant Chris Jent as Darvin Ham's top assistant, sources say
articles.description: The Los Angeles Lakers have agreed to hire Atlanta Hawks assistant Chris Jent as Darvin Ham's top assistant coach on his staff, sources told ESPN's Adrian Wojnarowski.

articles.title: Justin Thomas denied free drop after tee shot lands near drain during third round of U.S. Open
articles.description: On the par-4, 385-yard fourth hole Saturday afternoon at the U.S. Open, Justin Thomas' tee shot stopped a couple of inches from a drain, but he was denied a free drop by a USGA rules official in Brookline, Massachusetts.

articles.title: Sources - Kenny Atkinson won't take Charlotte Hornets job, will stay with Golden State Warriors
articles.description: After agreeing to be the Hornets' next head coach, Kenny Atkinson has changed his course and will remain an assistant with the Warriors, sources told ESPN's Adrian Wojnarowski.
articles.content:
Kenny Atkinson has decided he won't become the Charlotte Hornets' head coach and instead will remain with the Golden State Warriors as the top assistant, sources told ESPN's Adrian Wojnarowski.

articles.title: Where Stephen Curry ranks among the NBA's all-time great guards after securing his fourth title
